moves.2... Na6: Not a good move for Black; better to do Nc6 instead.
moves.3... b6: Black probably wants to do Bb7 with this move.
moves.5... Nc6: Moving the knight out of the way
moves.6... Nb8: Instead of doing this move to keep the knight safe, it might have been better to do Ne7.
moves.7. Bd2: Preparing to move out my bishop.
moves.7... a5: Black moves out the pawn. If I were in this position, I would have moved it to a6 instead to force me to move the bishop.
moves.11... Bd6: Black moves the bishop, threatening the knight
moves.12. b4: Moving out my pawn. Looking back, this probably wasn't the smartest move; now my bishop has limited options.
moves.17... Na6: Black moves the knight, although it wasn't in any danger because the bishop protected it.
moves.19... Ke7: I can't seem to figure out why Black made this move. If I were Black, I'd have done cxb4 instead. That way, I'd either have to leave it as-is or else take the pawn, in which case Black could easily capture my bishop with his own.
moves.20. bxc5: I prevent Black from seeing that move
moves.21... Bb8: There was no reason for Black not to take my pawn; it was completely unprotected.
moves.26... Qb7: Black moves the queen to threaten my bishop
moves.27. Qxd5+: Taking the pawn and checking the king
moves.31... Bd6: Moving the bishop out of danger
moves.32. Kf1: Preparing to move my king out so I can use my bishop again
moves.33. Ke2: Not the best move; now that I think about it, I should have done Rxb4 instead.
moves.35. Rxb4: I see the move I should have made several turns ago
moves.38. e4+: Protecting the knight and checking the king
moves.39... Ra2: I really don't know why Black did this. If I was in this situation, I'd instead do h5 to provide some extra protection to that g-pawn
moves.41... Ra1: Considering I now have a three move checkmate, I would have perhaps done Ra6 to prevent it.
